data.title: Display a popup detailing missing cache resource dependencies
data.body:
Currently if a user removes an asset that another asset is dependent on, the consequences are not experienced until playing and then it's difficult to diagnose from the logs. Regenerating the cache generates errors in the log about the missing resources, but wading through the logs to pick these up is inefficient.

What would be really useful is a window that pops up when such missing dependencies are detected, with a tree view showing the dependency route. So for example, if a model is loaded and one of the textures are missing:

Path\To\Model.fbx
|-Path\To\Material.material
  |-Path\To\Texture.png (Highlighted/red)

Having a menu option under Tools to explicitly regenerate the cache and/or scan for broken assets would be useful as well.

data.title: Double click to maximize on window title bar causes mouse cursor issues (OSX)
data.body:
On OSX:

1)  Start the editor and resize the window so that it is not maximized, like 1/2 of the screen
2)  Resize the window by double clicking the title bar to maximize
3)  The mouse cursor is unable to click on elements in the maximized area

data.title: Engine configuration via JSON
data.body:
This is step 1 of configuring the engine per application, applying quality settings, etc

A project can have a Settings/Engine.json file such as: 

https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicExamples/blob/master/RoboMan3D/Settings/Engine.json

This file will be parsed during play mode and the player configured appropriately, as the editor is a separate process, we can set varying levels of antialiasing, render paths, etc without affecting the editor process.

Deployment is not currently handled and there is UI work in order to make the settings easy to configure from the editor.  This PR also focuses on desktop app settings.

data.title: Update to Duktape 1.4
Add per project settings which can be configured by a JSON file
data.body: Expose per project Engine configuration via a JSON settings file (UI editing to follow)

data.title: Adding Linux CI task for PR validation, tweaking Linux build
Make CMake in Linux work correctly.
data.body:
I made a bare Ubuntu VM to see if I could compile Atomic, and I ran into quite a few pitfalls. The first few of those are documented in AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine#555 . The last few were related to node and libcurl not being present on my bare Ubuntu machine, although they are (or should be) available in the Atomic repo itself. I added node, and linked the correct libcurl. There were also some linker errors due to NETCore and NETScript not being linked in Linux. We could (probably should) automatically set the CMAKE variable LINUX to TRUE in cache if the CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME is "Linux" instead of requiring it to be set on the cmake command line.

All of that is fixed with this PR, so hopefully this will help the Linux build along.

data.title: Atomic.graphics.getRGBFormat() is undefined on master
data.body: The getRGBFormat function is undefined on master, which is causing a problem with the RenderToTexture example as well

data.title: Ensure all Artifacts are removed before building on CI
data.body: Right now, some artifacts folders persist on the build box between builds, this can make catching things like missing folders during the build difficult

data.title: WebRequest for native
data.body:
This WebRequest class uses libcurl to make http/https requests.

It has planned support for Emscripten, which is not included, but it's partially done (I needed to make some of it to make sure that the API will match properly with the native version).

To make it work across iOS, Android, OSX, and Windows, I had to pull zlib out of Assimp and get gzip functionality compiling. Assimp and libcurl now use a common zlib static library.

Also, some of libcurl's CMake build system was added. I plan to make iOS, OSX, and Windows use their own TLS implementations eventually _(Update: This is now done, see commits and comments below.)_, but for now, they all use OpenSSL, which would be needed for new platforms, and is useful to have around for hashs and signatures.

There is an AtomicExamples pull request for example uses.

data.title: Fixes for #529
data.body:
- added a check in the welcome screen to verify that an example project exists on the file system before adding it to the example browser
- added a check to the CreateProject dialog to verify that the template to clone from exists before trying to clone it
